citations.narrative:
Housekeeping at the facility must be addressed, especially around the produce, that is stored in bins along the front wall
of the facility. On the top of the bins, are miscellaneous items such as: tools, gloves, a blanket for the primates, towels,
crackers, gum and a coffee cup. Storing these items directly on the produce bins does not protect the food supplies from
potential contamination.
The equipment used for cleaning is currently hung along the walls with shavings and debris on them. These cleaning tools
should be cleaned prior to being stored to promote good husbandry practices. Lastly, there is general clutter around the
facility that needs to be removed to help maintain good housekeeping standards at the facility.
Correct by: May 16, 2024
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
3.75(b) 
   
Housing facilities, general. 
Housekeeping at the facility must be addressed, especially around the produce, that is stored in bins along the front wall 
of the facility. On the top of the bins, are miscellaneous items such as: tools, gloves, a blanket for the primates, towels, 
crackers, gum and a coffee cup. Storing these items directly on the produce bins does not protect the food supplies from 
potential contamination.  
 
The equipment used for cleaning is currently hung along the walls with shavings and debris on them. These cleaning tools 
should be cleaned prior to being stored to promote good husbandry practices. Lastly, there is general clutter around the 
facility that needs to be removed to help maintain good housekeeping standards at the facility. 
Correct by: May 16, 2024 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
